synopsis.text: Ushio is a gifted freediver with the incredible ability to breathe underwater and control liquids. Along with his childhood friend Sara, he travels to a tropical paradise in search of the legendary Blue Butterfly fish. According to local myths, this elusive fish appears once a year in a dragon's mouth near the island. During their quest, Ushio and Sara meet Ayuuru, a local girl who seems to share Ushio's special talents. She may hold the key to finding the Blue Butterfly fish. As they dive deeper into sparkling emerald waters, Ushio and his friends draw closer to underwater wonders beyond imagination. But they soon realize Ayuuru and the Blue Butterfly fish harbor deeper secrets than they first believed. With mystifying abilities, new friendships, and the promise of discovery, Ushio's freediving holiday becomes an adventure exploring the magical connections between land and sea. Will he uncover the Blue Butterfly's hidden world? Or will its secrets remain submerged in the ocean's depths?
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
